intro: Cordia clarkei, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its rough, often hairy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. The fruit is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a food source for wildlife.
